title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message:
I have a wine damaged 820-3332 board no major signs of corrosion, when plugged in we get green to orange light when mag safe 2 is plugged in, however would not power on or get a fan spin, measures PBBUS G3H was low voltage between 4.6v and tested found an issue in the isl6259 chip, I ordered a few new chips, when they came in I soldered the new one on and still no post or fan spin, after replacing the island the voltage increased from 4.6 to 5.81v, while troubleshooting multi meter touch down on board and made a small short and now there is no longer a green light or orange coming from the MagSafe charger and now the dc in voltage is .481v. I am not sure on what is going on or where to start trouble shooting here, I could use some pointers in the right direction!

thanks 

Computer cave

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: Measure resistance of R7005. Measure resistance between pins 17/18 of the U7000, and 27/28 of the U7000. and obviously solder on a non-burned U7000. There's also a good chance of just bad soldering on the 2nd U7000.

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: If you had a green light and now you don't your soldering might be messed up... Make sure to push down on the chip while soldering... Once your done, Add some flux and then drag your iron across the pins.. Iv'e done it before where the ACOK pin wasn't soldered and resulted in no green light.

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: The no green light happened after measuring so he shorted something which killed the ISL and maybe R7005

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: we were getting  17/18-24.1v , 27/28-21.3v, which you're probably right about the U7000 being blown.

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: Just removed the U7000 replaced with a new chip, also removed all surrounding resistors and capacitors and replaced form donor board that had a bad Haswell CPU. Still no 3v42 and only ~0.5 coming in at the DC Jack, 4.1v on 17/18 of U7000, 21.1v pins 27/28 could it be that the SMC got shorted?

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message:
"we were getting 17/18-24.1v , 27/28-21.3v"

Now look at the diagram and tell me which voltage is waaay to high and what could cause this. Hint PPBUS should be 12.6V

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: We have found out that the isl chip has 3 pins that is being shorted, could this be caused by shortage in the smc chip?

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: *top of the island chip is being shorted to ground

title: 820-3332 no power getting to board wine damaged
message: Which chip are you talking about? The ISL6259 right? u7000? Which pins are shorted?
